meanings.definition: Magnificent and splendid appearance or display
meanings.sent1: The splendours of the fireworks lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The ballroom was filled with splendours of crystal chandeliers and golden decorations.
meanings.sent3: The children's faces lit up with joy at the splendours of the circus performance.
meanings.sent4: Nature's splendours in the form of a rainbow after the storm never fail to amaze.
meanings.sent5: The splendours of the royal palace left visitors in awe of its beauty.

meanings.definition: Brilliant or gorgeous light or color
meanings.sent1: The sunset painted the sky with splendours of orange and pink hues.
meanings.sent2: Her dress shimmered with splendours under the disco ball lights.
meanings.sent3: The artist used splendours of colors to create a vibrant and lively painting.
meanings.sent4: The gemstones on the crown sparkled with splendours fit for a queen.
meanings.sent5: The garden was filled with splendours of blooming flowers in every shade imaginable.

meanings.sent1: The ancient castle stood on the hill, a testament to the splendours of the past.
meanings.sent2: The ceremony was conducted with all the splendours befitting a royal event.
meanings.sent3: The cat strutted around the house as if it owned all the splendours within.
meanings.sent4: The mountain range displayed its splendours under the golden light of the setting sun.
meanings.sent5: The grand ballroom was adorned with splendours of gold and velvet, creating a regal atmosphere.
